w:r.w:t: A copy of an account by Rāmānanda Bā̃ḍā of petitions he made to Rudravīra Sāha and Bam Sāha in justification of his claim to control the Luthāma

सहस्र पुण्य राक जुरो । शुभमस्तु सर्वदा ।तिष्ठा दिन जुरो ।। ।।
सहस्र पुण्य राक जुरो । शुभमस्तु सर्वदा ।तिष्ठा दिन जुरो ।। ।।
मस्तु सर्वदा ।तिष्ठा दिन जुरो ।। ।मस्तु सर्वदा ।तिष्ठा दिन जुरो ।। ।मस्तु सर्वदा ।तिष्ठा दिन जुरो ।। ।मस्तु सर्वदा ।तिष्ठा दिन जुरो ।। ।मस्तु सर्वदा ।तिष्ठा दिन जुरो ।। ।

On Friday, [the concluding of] the 4th and [the beginning of] the 5th of the bright
On Friday, [the concluding of] the 4th and [the beginning of] the 5th of the bright fortnight of Vaiśākha in NS 820 (1700 CE), an image of
. Donors Dhanajyoti and his wife Rukamanī of Subāhāḥ donated 8
. From the income of the land, an
, the first day of Vaiśākha. A coat of whitewash shall be painted out of 2
s of lime and … shall be fed food items of their choice
of Oku Bāhāḥ (text: Vaṃku Bāhara), the members of the
. A certain amount has been allocated for renovation of the
. The person who feeds shall receive a thousandfold merit.

As many inscribed letters of this inscription have already faded, it is difficult to understand its content in full. But what we know from this inscription is Dhanajyoti and his wife Rukamanī from Subāhāḥ sponsored the installation of an image of
in Subāhāḥ and also donated land for observing the anniversary of the image. The actual
in which the image was installed is not clear, as the inscription is no longer at its original location. The
probably is the one to the east of the monastery.
